message_1: How many ways are there to select a committee of 4 people from a group of 8 people (assuming all members of the group are eligible to serve on the committee)?
message_2:
To determine the number of ways to select a committee of 4 people from a group of 8 people, we use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (8 in this case) and k is the number of people to be selected (4 in this case).

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!(8-4)!)

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!4!)

C(8, 4) = (8*7*6*5) / (4*3*2*1)

C(8, 4) = 1680 / 24

C(8, 4) = 70

So there are 70 ways to select a committee of 4 people from a group of 8 people.
